result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell E. Solem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 2:09pm. 
Defendant Russell E. Solem in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Mr. Solem makes a statement. 

The Court sentences Mr. Solem to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for employment and AODA treatment; this jail term is consecutive to the sentence in Case #16CM400..
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Solem is required to serve the jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges;  this amount is to be entered as a civil judgment   
recess 2:28pm.

[MK] cases #16CM104 and #16CM400 called briefly at 9:37am, and then at 10:12am. 
Defendant Russell E. Solem in court with Attorney Jon Spansail (for Attorney Glenn E Avena).  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial Appearance and Plea Hearing held in Case #16CM400:
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
-- Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Solem guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


In Case #16CM104, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Solem on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no acts of threats of violence
--to undergo an assessment for a Certified Batterers Intervention program
--to undergo any other type of assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand 
--to pay costs, fees, assessments including the DNA surcharge and the Domestic Abuse surcharge

Days Credit for time already served:  0 days.  
Apply the $150 cash bond toward payment of court financial obligations.

------------------------------------------------------------------

In Case #16CM400, the Court sentences Mr. Solem to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail (the Court does not give Huber privileges on this jail term), consecutive to any previously imposed sentence 
--0 days credit for time already served given
The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Solem on Probation for 2 years, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no acts of threats of violence
--to undergo an assessment for a Certified Batterers Intervention program
--to undergo any other type of assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand 
--to pay costs, fees, assessments including the DNA surcharge  

The Court requires Mr. Solem to report to the Jefferson County Sheriffs Office for Booking in Case #16CM400 today. 
recess 10:35am.

Case called at 2:15 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Russell E. Solem in court with Attorney Jon Spansail on behalf of Attorney Glenn Edward Avena. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Atty Spansail requests another date for sentencing
ADA Hall presents no obection to adjournment
Court reminds Mr. Solem that his bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

[MK] case called at 11:14am. 
Defendant Russell E. Solem in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Solem verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires a $150 Cash Bond (already posted), with conditions: 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the case with Michelle Solem
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 11:19am, reconvend 11:20am.
The Court reviews right to counsel and refers Mr. Solem to the PD Office.
recess 11:20am
